content.description: Start on pockets at about 7 ft height, and large low dish for a foot. Pull on and crank out a few moves before the angle lessens for an easy run to the top.
content.location: SE side of the main boulder, just right of a pine tree.

content.description: Start on right side of slab near an embedded red rock, head straight up. Tall enough to get a good number of moves in.
content.location: Slab that forms east wall of the corridor on east side of main boulder.

content.description: Left side of slab following some pockets trending left, then up to the top. Tall enough to get a good number of moves in.
content.location: Slab that forms east wall of the corridor on east side of main boulder.

content.description: Start at the obvious large pocket about 5 ft up near center(-ish) of slab, head straight up. Tall enough to get a good number of moves in.
content.location: Slab that forms east wall of the corridor on east side of main boulder.

content.description: Start in front of the arete with a good left hand side pull. Rock on and head to the top past a large pocket.
content.location: Slab that forms east wall of the corridor on east side of main boulder, right arete when facing it.

content.description: Sit start right of a bush and head up through nice pockets to a ledge and scoop above it.Problem #263 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P1.
content.protection: Pad. Has 1 bolt for TR if you prefer.
content.location: Head down the road from the parking area to a break in the trees just past the main boulder above.

content.description: Another fun highball that starts behind the bush, followed by big huck to the ledge out right, then on to the top.Problem #247 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P3.
content.protection: Pad. TR possible from a bolt.
content.location: The first major bulge/exposed rock on the left when heading down the road from the parking area.

content.description: Fun highball that climbs through a bulge and then cracks to the top. Starts behind the large bush.Problem #246 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P2.
content.protection: Pad. TR possible from a bolt.
content.location: The first major bulge/exposed rock on the left when heading down the road from the parking area.

content.description: Sit start (lay start) on the very low rail feature with your hands on the furthest holds to the right. Climb left along the small roof and then pull over the lip using small holds on the slab and exit left.
content.protection: pads and a spotter for the moves to the slab.
content.location: on the north facing roof of the rail boulder.  Start on the low left trending rail.

content.description: Start on the jugs and climb up to a pocket.  make a big move over the lip to another good pocket and top-out.
content.location: middle of roof side of the Rail boulder

content.description: Start matched on a sharp angled pocket. Make a big move to a glued crimp and make a hard match. Traverse left on lower holds avoiding jugs at the lip. Make a couple more move to a hole and top-out. All large jugs along the traverse are not used. The problem must finish making a huge move to a sloping left hand. The pocket at the end of the problem can only be used for your right hand. This is because tall people can just bypass the hard moves at the end and go straight to the pocket with their left hand.
content.location: Right side of the roof of the Rail boulder.

content.description: The Road Area and many problems on either side of the road the lead into the wash/canyon.
